Practical, community-rooted measures — clear policies, education in civil discourse, and restorative responses when harm occurs — build trust so diverse ideas can be tested without silencing those who are most vulnerable.
statements.601: Campuses should be run like a well-managed kitchen: encourage bold experimentation with ideas while enforcing clear, consistent rules that protect safety and the ability to learn. Practical training in civil discourse, accessible supports for those harmed, and neutral enforcement of harassment policies can let challenging conversations enrich campus life without silencing or harming participants.
statements.683: Free expression should be protected on campuses as essential to education, while clear, even‑handed rules must prevent harassment and preserve a safe space for learning. Grounded in years of classroom experience, policies ought to prioritize teaching critical thinking and civil discourse, predictable due process, and restorative responses so ideas can be tested without silencing or harming members of the community.
